term.title: Born–Oppenheimer (BO) approximation

item.text: Representation of the complete wavefunction as a product of an electronic and a nuclear part, Ψ r,R = Ψ e r,R Ψ N R) is sufficiently small and the nuclei, as compared to the rapidly moving electrons, appear to be fixed. The approximation breaks down near a point where two electronic states acquire the same energy (see Jahn–Teller effect). The BO approximation is often considered as being synonymous with the adiabatic approximation. More precisely, the latter term denotes the case when Ψ e diagonalize the electronic Hamiltonian. Thus, the adiabatic approximation is an application of the BO approximation.

item.alttext: Ψ r,R = Ψ e r,R Ψ N R
